cz.cuni.mff.bluebench.utils

Class GraphMLReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.cuni.mff.bluebench.utils.GraphMLReader

  • public class GraphMLReader
extends java.lang.Object
    GraphMLReader writes the data from a GraphML stream to a graph. Slightly modified code from Blueprints extensions.
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com), Alex Averbuch (alex.averbuch@gmail.com), Joshua Shinavier (http://fortytwo.net), Peter Macko (http://eecs.harvard.edu/~pmacko), Sidney Shaw (modified the code to reflect the needs of BlueBench)

      • setIngestAsUndirected

        public void setIngestAsUndirected(boolean ingestAsUndirected)
        Parameters:
        ingestAsUndirected - if true, ingest a directed graph as an undirected graph by doubling-up all edges

      • inputGraph

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> inputGraph(java.io.InputStream graphMLInputStream,
                                                           GraphFiller filler)
                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Input the GraphML stream data into the graph. In practice, usually the provided graph is empty.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the GraphML data is not correctly formatted
        Parameters:
        graphMLInputStream - an InputStream of GraphML data

      • inputGraph

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> inputGraph(java.io.InputStream graphMLInputStream,
                                                           GraphFiller filler,
                                                           int bufferSize)
                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Input the GraphML stream data into the graph. In practice, usually the provided graph is empty.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the GraphML data is not correctly formatted
        Parameters:
        graphMLInputStream - an InputStream of GraphML data
        bufferSize - the amount of elements to hold in memory before committing a transactions (only valid for TransactionalGraphs)

      • inputGraph

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> inputGraph(java.io.InputStream graphMLInputStream,
                                                           GraphFiller filler,
                                                           int bufferSize,
                                                           java.lang.String vertexIdKey,
                                                           java.lang.String edgeIdKey,
                                                           java.lang.String edgeLabelKey)
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Input the GraphML stream data into the graph. More control over how data is streamed is provided by this method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the GraphML data is not correctly formatted
        Parameters:
        graphMLInputStream - an InputStream of GraphML data
        bufferSize - the amount of elements to hold in memory before committing a transactions (only valid for TransactionalGraphs)
        vertexIdKey - if the id of a vertex is a <data/> property, fetch it from the data property.
        edgeIdKey - if the id of an edge is a <data/> property, fetch it from the data property.
        edgeLabelKey - if the label of an edge is a <data/> property, fetch it from the data property.

      • inputGraph

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Object> inputGraph(java.io.InputStream graphMLInputStream,
                                                           GraphFiller filler,
                                                           int bufferSize,
                                                           java.lang.String vertexIdKey,
                                                           java.lang.String edgeIdKey,
                                                           java.lang.String edgeLabelKey,
                                                           GraphProgressListener progressListener,
                                                           boolean ingestAsUndirected)
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Input the GraphML stream data into the graph. More control over how data is streamed is provided by this method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when the GraphML data is not correctly formatted
        Parameters:
        graphMLInputStream - an InputStream of GraphML data
        bufferSize - the amount of elements to hold in memory before committing a transactions (only valid for TransactionalGraphs)
        vertexIdKey - if the id of a vertex is a <data/> property, fetch it from the data property.
        edgeIdKey - if the id of an edge is a <data/> property, fetch it from the data property.
        edgeLabelKey - if the label of an edge is a <data/> property, fetch it from the data property.
        progressListener - the progress listener
        ingestAsUndirected - if true, ingest a directed graph as an undirected graph by doubling-up all edges
